intro: Enterosora goodmanii, commonly known as the Goodman's enterosora, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Native to specific regions in South America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
